description:
Gurdas Nijor, Senior Software Engineer at OpenGov Inc

Lisp programmers have understood the power of the concept of "code as data" for decades. Having a structured representation of your code allows for an untold number of new applications that go far beyond what can be achieved by treating it as a lifeless stream of characters.

Esprima, a parser for javascript pushes your development very far in that direction by allowing you access to an AST (abstract syntax tree) representation of your code, that coupled with the strong conventions and API of React allow for some pretty amazing applications that i'll demonstrate how to implement.
short_description: Gurdas Nijor, Senior Software Engineer at OpenGov Inc Lisp programmers have understood the power of the concept of code as data
title: React.js Conf 2015 - Unlocking the structure of your React applications with the AST
